required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.official_title: A Material Cost-Minimization Analysis for Hernia Repairs and Minor Procedures During a Surgical Mission in the Dominican Republic

brief_summary.textblock: Expenditures on material supplies and medications constitute the greatest per capita costs for surgical missions. We hypothesized that supply acquisition at nonprofit organization cost would lead to significant cost-savings compared to supply acquisition at US academic institution costs from the provider perspective for hernia repairs and minor procedures during a surgical mission in the Dominican Republic.

primary_outcome.measure: Expenditure on material supplies and medications
primary_outcome.description: Using quick response (QR) codes for accurate consumption accounting, non-profit and US academic institution unit costs are associated with each item in an electronic inventory system. Medication doses are recorded and QR codes for consumed items are scanned into a record for each sampled procedure.

arm_group.arm_group_label: Dominican Republic patients at NPO Outpatient Surgery Center

study_pop.textblock: Patients presenting to the Institute of Latin American Concern Center for surgical procedure, previously screened by local healthcare workers.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients presenting to the Institute of Latin American Concern Center for surgical procedure, previously screened by local healthcare workers.
- Require hernia surgery, hydrocelectomy, excision of benign cutaneous mass.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Did not require hernia surgery, hydrocelectomy, excision of benign cutaneous mass.

link.description: Health information for travelers to the Dominican Republic
